alert.note: Alert for San Luis Obispo County Beaches; Santa Barbara County Central Coast Beaches (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Coastal Flood Advisory issued January 11 at 4:04AM PST until January 11 at 12:00PM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON PST TODAY... ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM PST FRIDAY... * WHAT...For the High Surf Advisory, large breaking waves of 12 to 17 feet today, will subside slowly tonight, then drop below 10 feet Friday morning. There will be dangerous rip currents. For the Coastal Flood Advisory, minor coastal flooding expected at the time of the high tides this morning. * WHERE...San Luis Obispo County Beaches and Santa Barbara County Central Coast Beaches. * WHEN...For the Coastal Flood Advisory, until noon PST today. For the High Surf Advisory, until 9 AM PST Friday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of sea water is likely, around the time of high tide, over vulnerable low-lying coastal areas such as parking lots, beaches, and walkways. Significant damage to roads or structures is NOT expected. There is an increased risk for ocean drowning. Rip currents can pull swimmers and surfers out to sea. Large breaking waves can cause injury, wash people off beaches and rocks, and capsize small boats near shore. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...High tide this morning is predicted to be around 7 feet at 855 AM.
info.instruction: Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property. Do NOT drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Remain out of the water due to dangerous surf conditions, or stay near occupied lifeguard towers. Rock jetties can be deadly in such conditions, stay off the rocks.

area.areaDesc: San Luis Obispo County Beaches; Santa Barbara County Central Coast Beaches
